caption: Nothing outwardly wrong, although the food is certainly outshined by the decor. Their salads are their strength, the soup was a bit bland and the ravioli had powdered rather than grated parmesan. The bread is delicious, but served with cold butter. The fruit tarte is nice, although the serving is enormous.
Arugula beet salad with walnuts was very good. The atmosphere is gorgeous
Here for the secret Garden concert.... a delight.
Been eating there for years. Excellent service and staff

My mom and I ate here while staying in Omni. We approached the host stand and weren’t greeted, so we weren’t sure if we were supposed to seat ourselves. We picked up a menu to see what they had, then we were approached by a male server who asked if we needed a table. We told him yes, so he took the menus from us and sat us. Nice area, very pretty, there’s an option to sit outside as well. We were given water and a few minutes to figure out what we wanted. After a little bit, he came back and took our order. About 10-15 mins later our food was brought out by different server. We ate, it was pretty good. Then we sat for about 10-15 minutes after finishing out food until we could track the new server down for our check. Overall not a good experience, service was bad. We were never greeted, or simply told hello. The first server was rude and disappeared and we never saw him again. The second server was again rude, not personable at all. She never asked us how our meal was or anything. Food was good but wouldn’t go back. For such a nice hotel, I would expect better service.

The dining room is pretty, and the food was unobjectionable (though not particularly great), but our service was awful.  First, the restaurant had no booster seats, only a high chair--which was not really what my 3-year-old needed.  It worked out OK, but you rarely see a restaurant nowadays that doesn't offer both high chairs and booster seats.  Another black mark in the kid-friendly department was the mini-hamburgers on the children's menu:  the buns were miniature, but the patties were simply one full-sized patty cut into halves, which didn't really fit the buns.  Our server forgot to take drink orders for my son and me (the other adults were drinking wine already by that point); the hostess came by and got milk for my son, but when I asked about a drink for me, she told me the server would take my drink order, and when I noted he hadn't actually done so, and asked her to ask him about it, she ignored me.  For the impression I got, she might as well have said, "It's not my job."  The server did finally take my order 15 minutes or so later, but after that, he didn't offer to refill either my son's milk or my soft drink until the meal was nearly over.  And all of this while the restaurant was nearly deserted--so it's not like the staff was overwhelmed.  As we were about to leave, I needed to change my son's diaper, and discovered no changing station in the first (small, unisex) restroom I found.  I asked the hotel concierge where I could change him, and he gave me directions to the men's room...and as I was trying to process those, he added "You're welcome," seemingly indicating that I should have said "Thank you" already.  In any case, thanks would have been undeserved, because the restroom lacked anywhere to change a diaper.  Indeed, my wife then discovered that the women's room lacked a changing stand as well, though at least there was a couch she could use.
Service and food were superb! We had an excellent experience.
Amazing food, elegant atmosphere, pricey but worth it
I had the worst and most expensive broiled cheese sandwich ever.  Repeat previous for the deviled eggs too. Service was average, but poor for price! I would avoid.

A gorgeous space with an antique feel to it. Beautiful tables and wall paintings, but the food is hit-and-miss. The first time I ate there it was exquisite the second time it was pretty bad. And that was within 2 days
The room is beautiful. The staff are friendly. The food was good and normal priced for a hotel restaurant.  We enjoyed the breakfasts especially.

The staff is very courteous and the Federalist setting, as a historically protected landmark for DC, really stands out when you have the chance to sit in the dining room and take in the frescoes and surrounding touches. Salmon salad nicois was delicious! Brunch is a whole other experience you must try!

We were in Washington, D.C. in April 2017 and stayed at the Omni Shoreham. Robert's breakfast buffet was fabulous - omelets made to order, great variety of baked goods, pancakes & waffles, just about anything you could want.  For dinner, the herb crusted rack lamb was the best I have ever had and the portion size was more than generous.  Caesar salad was fresh and good size.  I did not realize that what I thought was going to be mashed potatoes, were actually pureed potatoes, but other than that everything else was delicious.  My granddaughter had the steak, which was cooked exactly as requested, so that's what I ordered the 2nd evening we dined at Robert's. Servers were very accommodating.
GRRRRRRRRRRRRROOOOOOOOOOOOOSSSSSSSSSSSS so don't advise u 2 go there
The frittata and crab bisque are extremely unsatisfying. The only thing worth coming here for are the fries and adorable little ketchup bottles.

Can I give it 0 stars!?! If you notice the red goop on my glass, when I noticed it, I told the waiter, and he said "oh they just take a glass and don't check" I ordered an arugula salad that was old and the romano cheese was almost ready to be thrown out.  My wife ordered 1/2 chicken with mushrooms and greens, which were all greasy. All in all, a really nasty experience.
The food wasn't satisfying,  nore was it filling. I don't know why I bought 400$ worth of it but it wasn't hard because the meals cost so much.

For upscale dining they need training. The duck confit was a thigh and leg finished in oven? This is just wrong, should have been breast and not re heated and might as well been chicken it was so mild. The filet was completely under seasoned. These are basics and unforgivable.  Our waitress didn't say a word that we could hear and then stood ten feet away the whole meal and stared at us. Prices were fine if the food was up to par. I imagine from other reviews that breakfast was the way to go but wouldn't risk another bad experience.
